definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: My neighbor giggled in embarrassment, looking at the table like I did.
sentences.chinese: 我的邻座局促不安地傻笑着，跟我一样盯着桌子看。

sentences.english: His only fellow-passengers were happy-looking families heading out for a few days at the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他邻座的的是准备去海滨度假的幸福的一家人。

sentences.english: Her seatmate smiled awkwardly without looking up from her magazine.
sentences.chinese: 她的邻座尴尬的笑了笑，头埋在杂志里抬都没抬一下。

sentences.english: Mr. Ward suspected that some of the juniors "accidentally" got some of my answers.
sentences.chinese: 他怀疑是我的邻座们“无意”中借鉴了我的答案。

sentences.english: At the examination he peeped at his neighbor's paper.
sentences.chinese: 他在考试时偷看了他邻座的卷子。

sentences.english: If you can not understand it well, ask your neighbors or fight attendants.
sentences.chinese: 如果您有任何疑问请向邻座旅客或乘务员询问。

sentences.english: My seatmate, the scientist, had his own reasons to be concerned.
sentences.chinese: 我的邻座，那个科学家有他自己需要担心的理由。

sentences.english: But the person sitting next to you can't shut up.
sentences.chinese: 但你的邻座一直讲个不停。
不要抄你的邻座的答案。

sentences.english: Ever sat next to one of those annoying kids that asked “Why?” to everything you said?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经对邻座那个老问为什么的小子烦过吗？

definition: by the window (referring to seats on a plane etc)
to sit at a table with others with whom one is unacquainted
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
to give up one's seat/to be seated
empress's throne/(fig.) first place in a feminine competition
abbr. for 空中小姐/stewardess/air hostess/female flight attendant
to hit on someone/to strike up a conversation/to start talking to end an awkward silence or embarrassing situation
